jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a Senior Java Developer to join their award-winning development team. As part of the role you will work as part of a dedicated project team collaborating with UI Developers, UI/UX Designers and Project Managers to ensure our projects are delivered on time and to spec.

The ideal developer should have a solid background as a Java developer with strong Spring framework experience, any experience with Angular.js or React.js is highly desirable. It’s essential that you are able to work collaboratively as well as autonomously when necessary.

The role is based on site in our Central London Head Office but will require you to travel to various client sites.

Essential

•	Strong core Java skills
•	Experience of web development with JEE, Spring MVC and/or Portal 
        Servers
•	Excellent knowledge of Spring Framework (3 and above) and a clear 
        understanding of dependency injection
•	Good understanding of Hibernate/JPA and Object-relational mapping, 
        including performance considerations
•	PostgreSQL
•	Experience with build tools- Maven, Ant
•	Continuous Integration- TeamCity
•	Experience integrating systems using a wide variety of protocols like 
        REST, SOAP, MQ, TCP/IP, JSON and a number of others
•	Good knowledge and experience of testing frameworks i.e. Junit, 
        Selenium, Cucumber
•	Proven ability to understand and troubleshoot large systems, drilling 
        down to code level to identify the root cause of issues
•	Experience managing production environments deployed to Cloud 
        services (PaaS/IaaS)
•	Source Code Management- Git, BitBucket, Subversion
•	Experience with agile tools and methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Confluence, 
        JIRA)
•	Team leading experience 
•	Excellent communication skills- written & oral

Desirable

•	Experience in UI development: JavaScript / jQuery / Angular 
•	Experience using AWS Elastic Beanstalk.
•	Liquibase, JDBC
•	Consultancy experience 

We offer a really strong team ethos and excellent opportunities for professional development. The successful candidate will possess excellent technical skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

Company Information 
Keytree helps companies become leaner, faster and more agile with our award-winning team of SAP experts and beautifully designed applications. The way we work sets us apart. Our multi-disciplined teams are built on a foundation of communications and accountability. We are driven by innovation and a passion for design and great user experience. 
At Keytree we work with our clients to understand their business goals and solve their problems using our technological and industry expertise.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for an experienced iOS Developer to join their award-winning development team. As part of the role you will work on the development of high quality bespoke mobile apps for a number of high-profile end clients

You will work as part of a dedicated project team collaborating with UI/UX Designers and Project Managers to ensure projects are delivered on time and to spec

The ideal developer should have a strong interest in the latest technologies and development techniques, which will be beneficial in influencing the technologies, used and best practices. It’s essential that you are able to work collaboratively as well as autonomously when necessary

The role is based in our office in **Calle Gran Vía 28013 Madrid**

**Required skills:**

- Proven experience in iOS Development building iOS applications using both Object C and Swift
- Experience building rich and complex iOS applications for iPhone and iPad
- Strong experience using Objective-C, Cocoa Touch, CocoaPods
- Strong Design Patterns and Object-Oriented programming skills
- Experience working with iOS frameworks (e.g. core data, UIKit, auto layout)
- Solid understanding of RESTful APIs
- Experience with version control- SVN or GIT
- Agile methodology
- Continuous integration (CI) and unit Testing for iOS

**Desired skills:**

- Flutter
- End to end application development lifecycle experience
- Experience with Data Security
- Exposure to Java or other programming languages is beneficial

Keytree offers a really strong team ethos and excellent opportunities for professional development. The successful candidate will possess excellent communication skills, will be used to working to deadlines and both a self-starter and a team player.

**This is a permanent role offering a competitive salary**

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

jobs.title: React.js Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a talented React.js Developer to join their growing product development team.

As part of the role you will work closely with a team firmware & software engineers and architects to deliver a truly exciting and innovative product.

**The successful candidate will:**

- Work with the existing team to design, deliver, document and test new functionality and upgrades to existing functions
- Participate in our Planning and Retrospective meetings where you will have direct input to the team
- Gain expertise in the tools and services we use: SAP Cloud Platform, Node, etc

**Required skills:**

- Strong front end development experience
- HTML5 & CSS3
- OO JavaScript
- 2yrs+ React.js
- Redux or Flux
- RESTful APIs
- GIT or SVN
- Agile Methodologies 

**Desired skills:**

- Some knowledge of SAP Cloud Platform and SAP Analytics would be advantageous
- SASS, LESS or Compass
- Java or Python

**_The role is based in our Port Talbot Office_**  **_with occasional travel._**

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

**Company Information**

Keytree helps companies become leaner, faster and more agile with our award-winning team of SAP experts and beautifully designed applications. The way we work sets us apart. Our multi-disciplined teams are built on a foundation of communications and accountability. We are driven by innovation and a passion for design and great user experience.

At Keytree we work with our clients to understand their business goals and solve their problems using our technological and industry expertise.

jobs.title: Agile Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Keytree a London-based technology company, multi-award winning for Innovation & Delivery, is hiring an experienced **Agile BA** to work on an exciting client project. As part of the role you will work closely with internal Keytree stakeholders and and external clients to help shape and scope projects.

You will lead and facilitate business engagements to establish scope, business needs, project objectives, outcomes and expectations on project delivery from initiation to release and maintenance. 

**Required Skills:**

- Strong experience working in project teams that employ Digital technology and techniques to solve complex problems
- Working to understand the existing business environment, business needs and eliciting business requirements from stakeholders at all levels of seniority.
- Confident challenging assumptions and requests; can present business re-design proposals and specify MVP solutions
- Ability to translate the vision into prioritised deliverable goals/stories
- Understands the different phases of product delivery, especially discovery and is able to contribute to the planning of or running of these.
- Active leadership and co-facilitation of Stand-ups, Retrospectives, Showcases, Planning sessions, Iteration planning and kick-off, and Story kick-off, ongoing desk-checks and story sign off
- Develop and manage Scrum sprint backlog (Epics, Stories, etc.).
- Develops prototypes to test out ideas, then iterates them based on user feedback
- Solid experience working in an Agile team to agree and develop system/product designs based on user requirements
- Can break down epics into manageable user stories including testable conditions of acceptance 
- Has strong facilitation skills to plan and deliver workshops
- Managing end-to-end clear traceability, maintenance, prioritisation, change control and approval mechanisms.
- Ability to collaborate with Dev Managers, Solutions Architects, Product Owners and more to negotiate and define project needs.
- Web/Digital Application experience
- Ability to create and sustain effective stakeholder relationships, across all levels
- Resilient and proactive with a strong delivery focus 
- Excellent communication skills- written and oral

**Desired Skills:**

- Experience using JIRA
- Business Analyst qualifications (e.g. ISEB diploma)
- Experience with the GDS (Government Digital Services) standards

Keytree offers a really strong team ethos and excellent opportunities for professional development. The successful candidate will possess excellent communication skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

**This is a permanent role based in our Central London Head Office but will require you to travel to various client sites.**

**No third party applicants **

jobs.title: Agile Project Manager
jobs.description:
- Responsible for day-to-day delivery of the end-to-end IT project (or multiple projects) to meet the agreed business requirements within timescale, cost and quality constraints working with the relevant resources to achieve the desired result including: 
- Estimating, scheduling, planning, tracking and controlling tasks to manage the scope of the project, ensuring sign off by the client prior to commencement of implementation
- Responsibility for setting and managing of budget 
- Reporting the progress of the project at agreed intervals 
- Preparing, managing and reporting on the project budget, monitoring project costs 
- Working with colleagues to develop solution options and delivery plans 
- Monitoring progress on plans, creating contingency plans for risks and addressing issues that arise in the course of projects and escalating to the relevant stakeholders and client when needed
- Responsibility for the quality assurance and standards and overall integrity of the project assisting project stakeholders to realise maximum potential/ opportunities with project deliverables
- Continually assessing whether the project continues to meet business objectives
- Liaise with Keytree, managed services team, during project transition to operational support

**Skills & Experience**

- Strong experience in dealing with senior business users 
- Track record of delivering medium to large scale projects.
- Project planning, estimating, monitoring and controlling tools and techniques 
- Risk management techniques - risk identification, analysis, estimation and mitigation 
- Quality management tools and techniques
- Strong experience of managing successful IT projects through the full project lifecycle using leadership qualities and management skills to ensure that project stays on plan 
- Familiar with IT architecture, design, operational service & support 
- Experience delivering projects using widely used technologies such as JAVA/J2EE, JavaScript- Angular.js & React.js, IOS technologies- Objective-C, SWIFT, Adobe AEM, Hybris, LifeRay etc.
- Familiar with the IT market & emerging trends 
- Ability to interact with technical and non-technical people 
- Ability to work under pressure & successfully prioritise work effectively
- Excellent experience with Agile/Scrum project management methodologies
- Experience with JIRA, GIT, or other PM/Development tools 

**This is a permanent opportunity based in our Port Talbot, Wales office.**

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

  • Risk management techniques - risk identification, analysis, estimation and mitigation
  • Quality management tools and techniques

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for an experienced Android Developer to join their award-winning development team. As part of the role you will work on the development of high quality bespoke mobile apps for a number of high-profile end clients. You will work as part of a dedicated project team collaborating with UI/UX Designers and Project Managers to ensure projects are delivered on time and to spec.

The ideal developer should have a strong interest in the latest technologies and development techniques, which will be beneficial in influencing the technologies, used and best practices. It’s essential that you are able to work collaboratively as well as autonomously when necessary.

**Required skills:**

- Proven experience in Android Development building applications using both Java and ideally Kotlin
- Experience building rich and complex Android applications for phone and tablet
- Strong Design Patterns and Object-Oriented programming skills
- Experience working with the Android SDK frameworks
- Solid understanding of RESTful APIs
- Experience with version control- SVN or GIT
- Agile methodology
- Continuous integration (CI) and unit Testing for Android

**Desired skills:**

- Flutter
- End to end application development lifecycle experience
- Experience with Data Security

At Keytree we are passionate about our products and the evolving technologies we use to build them. This is a permanent opportunity based in our **Calle Gran Vía, 62 28013 Madrid** office.

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

jobs.title: Back End Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a talented Back End Developer to join their growing product development team. As part of the role you will work on our Matrix booking application working closely with a team of software engineers and architects to deliver a truly exciting and innovative product. The ideal candidate should have strong experience in Java development and ideally experience integrating to MS Graph API, Calendar API, Google GSuite or Gsuite Calendar API

Matrix Booking is the leading resource management, meeting room and desk booking software. Award-winning, open, secure and specifically designed to be quick and easy to implement. Appropriate for the requirements of all modern organisations, Matrix Booking can be applied to a range of resources including meeting room and desk booking, offices, car parking and hardware. Make, change or cancel bookings on the go via the Matrix Booking Mobile App, web or Outlook.

Required Skills:
•	Strong core Java skills (Java 8+)
•	JAX-RS (Jersey) 
•	JPA (EclipseLink) 
•	DbUnit 
•	Spring Boot 2.x
•	Spring Testing
•	Experience with agile tools and methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Confluence, 
        JIRA)

Desirable Skills: 
•	Liquibase
•	Spring Security
•	DeltaSpike Data 
•	CDI 
•	Experience integrating to MS Graph API, Calendar API, Google GSuite or 
        Gsuite Calendar API 
•	Experience in UI development: JavaScript / jQuery / Angular 

This is a great opportunity for a developer looking for an innovative and challenging environment with fantastic opportunities for growth and progression.
The successful candidate will possess excellent technical skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

The role is based in our Port Talbot Office with occasional travel.

jobs.title: Firmware/IoT Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a talented Firmware/IoT Developer to join their growing product development team working on the innovative head impact project, Protecht. As part of the role you will work closely with a team firmware & software engineers and architects to deliver a truly exciting and innovative product.

The Protecht is a collaboration between a number of key stakeholders: SAP, SWA and Keytree. The aim is to create a product that will increase the safety of sports players by providing early warning of potentially dangerous head impact information to pitch-side support personnel.

The initial stages are focused on Rugby and the Welsh Rugby Football Union; however, the product has potential in many sports or high-risk scenarios, and these will be considered once the initial concept has been proven.

Release 1 is now complete, and the next exciting phase of the project is to roll out the system to a wide range of professional clubs.

The Keytree team is a mix of firmware and software engineers and architects delivering a truly exciting and innovative product. We have a wide range of technologies supported by a small team and this provides a lot of scope for personal development and building a wide breadth of knowledge.

The candidate will ideally have:

- 2+ years of experience developing firmware with C
- Good understanding of RF and RF Testing needs
- Ideally experience of Node.js, Python or additional language
- SQL knowledge and Database design
- Demonstrate a breadth of technical knowledge with regards to rolling out new products and services across multiple technologies
- Basic knowledge of Linux environments

The successful candidate will:

- Work with the existing team to design, deliver, document and test new functionality and upgrades to existing functions
- Be responsible for creating new firmware versions and debugging and resolving issues within firmware
- Participate in our Planning and Retrospective meetings where you will have direct input to the team
- Gain expertise in the tools and services we use: IoT devices, Python, SAP Cloud Platform, Node, etc.
- Work on the set up and management of the Protecht solution including application development, infrastructure set up and enablement
- Support customers both remotely and pitch side in the operation of the Protecht solution

_This is a permanent opportunity based in our Port Talbot Office_ **_with occasional travel._**

**Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.**

At Keytree we are passionate about our products and the evolving technologies we use to build them. The Developer will need to share our passion for craftsmanship in software design and development and continuous improvement in the techniques, tools and languages we use; as well as have an appreciation for business objectives and delivering superior, innovative software solutions.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

- Gain expertise in the tools and services we use: IoT devices, Python, SAP Cloud Platform, Node, etc.
- Work on the set up and management of the Protecht solution including application development, infrastructure set up and enablement
- Support customers both remotely and pitch side in the operation of the Protecht solution
The candidate will ideally have:
- 2:1 or above in an electrical/electronic engineering degree
- Demonstrable application of your technical skills through hands-on projects, either university or personal projects 
- Experience developing firmware with C
- Good understanding of RF and RF Testing needs
- Ideally experience of Node.js, Python or additional language
- SQL knowledge and Database design
- Basic knowledge of Linux environments
- Creative approach to problem solving
**The is a permanent role based in our Port Talbot Office **** with occasional travel. We are offering a great salary and benefits with training and development offered from day one.**  
  
**Company Information **

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a graduate Firmware/IoT Developer to join their growing product development team working on the innovative head impact project, Protecht. As part of the role you will work closely with a team firmware & software engineers and architects to deliver a truly exciting and innovative product.

The Protecht is a collaboration between a number of key stakeholders: SAP, SWA and Keytree. The aim is to create a product that will increase the safety of sports players by providing early warning of potentially dangerous head impact information to pitch-side support personnel.

The initial stages are focused on Rugby and the Welsh Rugby Football Union; however, the product has potential in many sports or high-risk scenarios, and these will be considered once the initial concept has been proven.

Release 1 is now complete, and the next exciting phase of the project is to roll out the system to a wide range of professional clubs.

The Keytree team is a mix of firmware and software engineers and architects delivering a truly exciting and innovative product. We have a wide range of technologies supported by a small team and this provides a lot of scope for personal development and building a wide breadth of knowledge.

As a Firmware/ IoT Developer you will play an integral role in testing and analysis of electronics at circuit and product level for new designs. Testing and assessing the reliability and robustness of our designs. Solving electronics challenges to create better, faster, more cost-effective solutions for Protecht.This is a great opportunity for a graduate with a passion for technology and strong interest in IoT. Keytree are offering extensive training and development in order to help the right candidate become a product expert

The successful candidate will:

  • Work with the existing team to design, deliver, document and test new functionality and upgrades to existing functions
  • Be responsible for creating new firmware versions and debugging and resolving issues within firmware
  • Participate in our Planning and Retrospective meetings where you will have direct input to the team
  • Gain expertise in the tools and services we use: IoT devices, Python, SAP Cloud Platform, Node, etc.
  • Work on the set up and management of the Protecht solution including application development, infrastructure set up and enablement
  • Support customers both remotely and pitch side in the operation of the Protecht solution The candidate will ideally have:
  • 2:1 or above in an electrical/electronic engineering degree
  • Demonstrable application of your technical skills through hands-on projects, either university or personal projects
  • Experience developing firmware with C
  • Good understanding of RF and RF Testing needs
  • Ideally experience of Node.js, Python or additional language
  • SQL knowledge and Database design
  • Basic knowledge of Linux environments
  • Creative approach to problem solving The is a permanent role based in our Port Talbot Office ** with occasional travel. We are offering a great salary and benefits with training and development offered from day one.**

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a mid to senior level Java Developer to join their award-winning development team. As part of the role you will work as part of a dedicated project team collaborating with UI Developers, UI/UX Designers and Project Managers to ensure our projects are delivered on time and to spec.

The ideal developer should have a solid background as a Java developer with strong Spring framework experience, any experience with Angular.js or React.js is highly desirable. It’s essential that you are able to work collaboratively as well as autonomously when necessary.

The role is based in our Central London Head Office but requires frequent travel to our client’s office in Warwickshire.

Technologies:
•	Java 8, Spring, Maven
•	Spring MVC, Spring Security, Jackson, Retrofit, JAXB, Apache CXF
•	Liquibase, EclipseLink, JPA, Sping Data
•	jUnit, Mockito, DBUnit, WireMock
•	SQL Databases (e.g. PostgreSQL)
•	CI/CD - tools such as TeamCity, Jenkins, Git, Nexus
•	SAP Cloud Platform (Tomcat 8), AWS

Required skills:
•	Software development experience (Java 8 onwards)
•	Hands-on expertise with application design and automated testing
•	Experience with Spring based applications including MVC and Spring 
        Security
•	Knowledge of Java web application and integration architectures e.g. 
        Servlets, REST, WS, event-based patterns
•	Experience of running Java applications in a cloud environment
•	Experience developing and consuming RESTful API’s
•	Experience with SQL data stores e.g. JPA, SQL, Postgres
•	Experience with Java build tooling e.g. Maven
•	Knowledge of automated build / continuous delivery e.g. Jenkins, 
        TeamCity
•	Good collaboration and communication skills
•	Experience in Agile techniques
•	Exposure to commercial aspects of consultancy work e.g. estimation, 
        proposal writing

Desirable skills:
•	Front end web development skills such as HTML5, JS & CSS 
•	Strong technical writing
•	Experience with cloud PaaS solutions
•	Experience with logging and monitoring tooling
•	Experience with configuration management e.g. Terraform

We offer a really strong team ethos and excellent opportunities for professional development. The successful candidate will possess excellent technical skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

jobs.title: Office 365 Consultant
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for an experienced Office 365 Developer to join their growing product development team for Matrix Booking. Matrix Booking is the leading resource management, meeting room and desk booking software. Award-winning, open, secure and specifically designed to be quick and easy to implement. Appropriate for the requirements of all modern organisations, Matrix Booking can be applied to a range of resources including meeting room and desk booking, offices, car parking and hardware. Make, change or cancel bookings on the go via the Matrix Booking Mobile App, web or Outlook.

As part of the role you will work on the integration of Matrix with our various clients Office 365 platforms whilst developing our Office 365 offering.

**Required Skills:**

- Strong experience in managing an Office 365 implementation.
- Strong experience integrating enterprise applications with Office 365
- Excellent knowledge of Office 365 services (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Azure AD, PowerApps and Flow)
- Design, Input and review of solution designs, both at and high and low level, including test and migration strategies
- Experience of using Graph API, specifically around calendar
- Understanding of integration with Skype for Business and Teams
- Development experience with .NET
- Ability to support pre-sales
- Excellent communication skills

**Desired Skills:**

- Development experience using Java, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript

This is a great opportunity to join an innovative and challenging environment with fantastic opportunities for growth and progression.

The successful candidate will possess excellent technical skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

**_The role is based in our Port Talbot Office_**  **_with occasional travel._**

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

jobs.title: QA Tester
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting a talented QA Tester to work on a number of cutting-edge services and developments. You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team working on a variety of client projects. You will work alongside the Development team assigned for a dedicated business area, reporting to the Test Lead/Manager. The key function will be to ensure a quality product is delivered to the client at all times and with that, fixes to the existing product are resolved in line with delivery of new features.

The QA Tester will work with the wider team to ensure the project team's deliverables meet the business and non-functional requirements and help maintain all quality assurance controls. This includes development of appropriate stories and conditions of acceptance, agreement of these with the customer, and ensuring their successful execution through reviews and Manual testing. It is expected that the QA Tester will be involved at all stages of the SDLC; requirements, analysis, design, testing and release ensuring quality at all stages of the project, driving continuous improvement through root cause analysis of defects.

**_The role is based in our Port Talbot office with occasional travel._**

**Core responsibilities**

- Creation of test plans to analyse how testing for a project will be carried out
- Creating and reviewing Conditions of Acceptance
- Carrying out execution tests as documented in the test plans
- Log bugs using JIRA and work with developers to resolve them
- Retesting and closing bugs when they have been resolved
- Keeping clear records of all bugs identified
- Report progress on development at daily stand-ups and escalate issues in a timely fashion, identifying remedial action to keep the project on track

**Professional Experience**

- Good experience of software testing within challenging and changeable environments comprising diverse technologies
- Good experience working in an agile software development environment
- Good broad experience with the full software development life cycle, including design, testing (Functional, Non-Functional, and User Acceptance Testing), deployment, and documentation activities

**Essential**

- Minimum 3 years experience as a QA tester or similar role
- Knowledge of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) and STLC (Software test life cycle) standard
- Experience working with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle
- Experience in creating, executing and maintaining test cases as well as test plans
- Creating BDD’s for the stories in the program within Jira
- Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and other tools such as Confluence, Jira and Wiki’s
- Experienced in using test management tools, preferably HP Quality Centre 
- Experience of creating manual test scripts
- Experience testing iOS, Android and web applications
- Strong UI testing experience
- Excellent experience of responsive cross-browser testing
- Excellent attention to detail
- Excellent written and oral communicator

**Desirable skills**

- SAP testing experience
- Automation testing experience using Selenium Webdriver or Cucumber

Keytree offers a really strong team ethos and excellent opportunities for professional development. The successful candidate will possess excellent communication skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

  • Good broad experience with the full software development life cycle, including design, testing (Functional, Non-Functional, and User Acceptance Testing), deployment, and documentation activities

Essential

  • Minimum 3 years experience as a QA tester or similar role
  • Knowledge of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) and STLC (Software test life cycle) standard
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle
  • Experience in creating, executing and maintaining test cases as well as test plans
  • Creating BDD’s for the stories in the program within Jira
  • Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and other tools such as Confluence, Jira and Wiki’s
  • Experienced in using test management tools, preferably HP Quality Centre
  • Experience of creating manual test scripts
  • Experience testing iOS, Android and web applications
  • Strong UI testing experience
  • Excellent experience of responsive cross-browser testing
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Excellent written and oral communicator

Desirable skills

  • SAP testing experience
  • Automation testing experience using Selenium Webdriver or Cucumber

Keytree offers a really strong team ethos and excellent opportunities for professional development. The successful candidate will possess excellent communication skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.

jobs.title: Reporting Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree are currently recruiting for an experienced Reporting Developer to join their award winning development team. You will be will be involved in a greenfield S/4 Hana implementation with an emphasis on POS integration, finance and procurement. As part of the role of Reporting Developer you will be working on developing BI reporting solutions within a team environment supporting the project and site integration. You will be working with the functional team and other developers in the build and unit tests of these items.

**The role is based in our Gran Via Madrid office.**

**Required Skills:**

- Very strong working knowledge of SQL (or SQLScript), ABAP  
CDS, Fiori Apps, KPI Tiles.
- Good knowledge of S/4 data model – understanding of VDM  
concepts and S/4 development paradigms.
- Strong knowledge of HANA Modelling – Calculation Views  
(Graphical/Scripted) and general HANA development concepts.
- Knowledge of BW development (BW/BEx queries).

**Desirable Skills:**

- Functional knowledge of enterprise processes – sales,  
procurement, finance, etc.
- Knowledge of S/4 Embedded Analytics 
- SAP BW or ECC/S4 background.

**This is a permanent opportunity offering a great salary, exciting client projects and opportunities for growth and progression.**

**Direct Applicants Only**

**Company Information**

Keytree helps companies become leaner, faster and more agile with our award-winning team of SAP experts and beautifully designed applications. The way we work sets us apart. Our multi-disciplined teams are built on a foundation of communications and accountability. We are driven by innovation and a passion for design and great user experience.

At Keytree we work with our clients to understand their business goals and solve their problems using our technological and industry expertise.

jobs.title: SAP Solution Architect - EAM
jobs.description:
***Job Title:***

**EAM Solutions Architect / Director**

***Location:***

London

***Department:***

 

***Date:***

6th Oct 2019

***Job Spec Ref:***

 

***Job Purpose:***

Assist Keytree to achieve its growth objectives by:

- Supporting the sale of engagements that include SAP Enterprise Asset Management solutions
- Ensuring EAM projects are successfully delivered
- Developing other EAM delivery and solution team members
- Develop Keytree into new industries, propositions, services, technologies 

##### **Key Activities:**

- To support qualification of initial leads and determine appropriate bid team.
- Own bid lifecycle for EAM bids and contribute to larger bids (that include other SAP solutions)
- Quality assurance on proposals documents and presentations 
- To be part of the initial EAM project delivery team in order to architect the solution design, de-risk the project and ensure that those initial project phases are a success
- Asist clients in the development of compelling business cases for the adoption of SAP EAM solutions
- To build strong industry/partner relationships  
- To develop own skill set to maintain ‘thought leadership’ status in customer’s and peers’ eyes
- Assist in recruitment and resourcing of EAM delivery team members and solution architects
- Mentor Keytree EAM team members

##### **Core Competencies:**

- Strong track record of architecting and delivering EAM solutions for SME and larger clients
- Strong knowledge of S/4HANA EAM, Asset Manager / Work Manager and Asset Intelligence Network
- Knowledge of S/4HANA Project and Portfolio Management and Commercial Project Management would be desirable
- Can conceptualize and communicate winning propositions – making complex ideas look simple
- Bright, ability to rapidly pick-up new technologies, propositions and business areas
- Outcome oriented – maximizing balance of effort vs benefit to achieve objectives
- Demonstrates excellent communication skills both verbally and in writing
- Ability to work under own initiative and under tight time pressures - planning, prioritising and controlling own workload and that of your team members
- Ability to assert own ideas to clients and within Keytree senior management
- Continuous improvement - Inquisitive – “self teaching” of relevant new business thinking and technology solutions.
- Proactively contributes to the body of knowledge at Keytree
- Good network in order to help scale the delivery and solution team in this area

##### **Role Competencies:**

- Detailed knowledge of SAP EAM business requirements and solutions 
- Hands-on solution experience with ability to demonstrate the end to end S/4HANA EAM solution as part of VAR/CCP deals and during Discovery / Explore workshops
- Broad knowledge of Ketytree’s integrated propositions, technologies, differentiation and track record
- Work with commercial team to conceptualize and communicate winning propositions
- Lead / support the preparation and delivery of sales proposals and presentations 
- Entrepreneurial – can identify and develop opportunities within existing accounts 
- Ability to organise and co-ordinate diverse groups in complex situations – eg working with teams of Keytree, SAP and 3rd party team members
- Lead functional / technical architecture in complex environments
- Support the Programme Director to develop phasing strategy, plans, benefits case, org structures, risks and issues
- Manages design workshops on multiple area of expertise
- Command the respect and confidence of other Solution Architects, Solution Directors and the Commercial Team
- Ability to develop Keytree’s methods and tools and contribute to Solution Team strategy

jobs.title: Scrum Master
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for an experienced Scrum Master to join their growing product development team for Matrix Booking. Matrix Booking is the leading resource management, meeting room and desk booking software. Award-winning, open, secure and specifically designed to be quick and easy to implement. Appropriate for the requirements of all modern organisations, Matrix Booking can be applied to a range of resources including meeting room and desk booking, offices, car parking and hardware. Make, change or cancel bookings on the go via the Matrix Booking Mobile App, web or Outlook.

**The Scrum Master will be responsible for the following:**

- Responsible for setting and managing of budget
- Reporting the progress at agreed intervals
- Preparing, managing and reporting on the project budget, monitoring project costs
- Working with colleagues to develop solution options and delivery plans
- Monitoring progress on plans, creating contingency plans for risks and addressing issues that arise in the course of the product development and escalating to the relevant stakeholders and client when needed
- Responsible for the quality assurance and standards and overall integrity of the project assisting project stakeholders to realise maximum potential/ opportunities with project deliverables
- Continually assessing whether the project continues to meet business objectives

**Required Skills:**

- First level Scrum Master certification (CSM, PSM I) 
- Experience in a Scrum Master role for minimum of 3 years for a software development team that was diligently applying Scrum principles, practices, and theory. 
- Knowledge of numerous well documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach (e.g. Burndown techniques, Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc.) 
- Knowledge and/or experience with widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games 
- Strong knowledge and experience using JIRA toolset
- End to end application management lifecycle experience
- Automated Code deployment & automated testing
- Experience with version control- SVN or GIT

**Desired Skills:**

- Second level Scrum Master certification (CSP, PSM II) 
- Knowledge of other Agile approaches: XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD, etc.
- ITIL v3 Foundation qualification
- AWS Experience
- IOT
- Exposure to Java or other programming languages is beneficial
- Experience working with iOS frameworks and Hybrid apps
- Experience with ReactJs or AngularJs
- Good understanding of RESTful APIs

This is a great opportunity for a Scrum Master/ PM looking for an innovative and challenging environment with fantastic opportunities for growth and progression. The successful candidate will possess excellent technical skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

**This is a permanent opportunity based in our Port Talbot, Wales office.**

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

jobs.title: Senior iOS Developer
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a Senior iOS Developer to join their award-winning development team. As part of the role you will work on the development of high quality bespoke mobile apps for a number of high-profile end clients. You will work as part of a dedicated project team collaborating with UI/UX Designers and Project Managers to ensure projects are delivered on time and to spec.

The ideal developer should have a strong interest in the latest technologies and development techniques, which will be beneficial in influencing the technologies, used and best practices. It’s essential that you are able to work collaboratively as well as autonomously when necessary.

**This is a permanent role is based in our Central London, Head Office**

**The successful candidate will:**

- Speak fluent English and write competently
- Have good interpersonal skills and be comfortable working in a collaborative, team environment. 
- Be competent and comfortable when presenting to customers and supporting sales efforts

**Required skills:**

- At least 4 years proven experience in iOS Development building iOS applications using both Object C and Swift 4.0 or greater
- Experience building rich and complex iOS applications for iPhone and iPad
- Strong Design Patterns and Object-Oriented programming skills
- Experience working with iOS frameworks (e.g. core data, UIKit, auto layout)
- Solid understanding of RESTful APIs
- Experience with version control- SVN or GIT
- Agile methodology
- Continuous integration (CI) and unit Testing for iOS
- Experience as Architect of highly functional iOS apps, ensuring that architectural integrity is maintained
- Experience of highly automated build pipelines
- Experience as a Lead Developer, supporting other developers to create consistent and high-quality code

**Desired skills:**

- End to end application development lifecycle experience
- Experience with Data Security
- Exposure to Java, Node or other programming languages is beneficial
- ARKit, ML and Computer vision
- VOIP and CallKit
- App Localisation and Globalization
- Experience working on projects related to selling, retail or e-commerce

This is a permanent opportunity based in our Central London Head Office offering a competitive salary plus benefits as well as opportunities for professional development.

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

jobs.title: Service Desk Manager
jobs.description:
- Articulate with excellent written and spoken English.
- Customer focussed approach
- Strong people manager, able to lead and grow the Service Desk
- Excellent MS Office Skills
- Strong experience in ITIL processes and ITSM toolsets.
- Experience in Jira including administration and reporting.
- Strong data analysis skills and attention to detail.
- Able to provide accurate progress/status reporting to senior management raise risks and issues as appropriate
- Articulate problems clearly and concisely, identifying challenges in their resolution.
- Create & maintain strong working relationships with other members of the support team and the wider technology organisation so that the overall function operates professionally and maintains a delivery focus.  
- Engage professionally with customers when required.
- Participate in team activities and team planning with the aim of improving team skills, awareness and quality of work within agreed timescales
- To understand and comply with internal departmental processes and standards

**Key Requirements**

- Experience managing the delivery of support services both internally and externally - this would include management of service desk, infrastructure and application support.
- Experience driving internal change processes within an organisation and overseeing service transition during key projects, whilst ensuring business and IT continuity.
- Experience dealing with a variety of stakeholders from supplier meetings to service reviews.
- Experience in managing SLA's and ensuring technology in place to support the delivery of excellent customer service.
- Knowledge of information security and how to ensure compliance whilst delivering an excellent service offering.
- ITIL (V3) Foundation qualified
- Experience running a 24x7 Service Desk including resourcing and shifts.
- Capable of reasoning and thinking through problems and be able to independently and jointly develop desired solutions. 
- Self-motivated and willing to "do what it takes" to get the job done
- Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to clearly communicate and share solutions with fellow team members
- Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills

**What you will be doing?**

- Reporting in to the Head of Managed Services you will manage the delivery of 24x7 service offering, ranging from internal infrastructure support to end user ‘client’ application support.
- Ensuring Incidents, Problems, Changes and Service Requests are logged and progressed through their respective ITIL process to appropriate support consultants.
- Manage provision of internal & external reporting requirements including SLA, Aging & Customer Satisfaction.
- Supporting Service Transition of new clients or projects into Managed Services
- Own and manage the ITSM Service Desk tool (create & maintain clients and process configuration).
- You will meet with various stakeholders including clients supporting Delivery Managers providing service reviews to ensure optimum satisfaction.

Keytree offers a really strong team ethos and excellent opportunities for professional development. The successful candidate will possess excellent communication skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

**This is a permanent role offering a highly competitive salary based in our Port Talbot Office.**

**No third party applicants**

jobs.title: Workshop Lead
jobs.description:
Keytree is currently recruiting for a talented Workshop Lead to join their growing product development team for KIT (Keytree In store Technology). As part of the role you will work closely with a team firmware & software engineers and architects to deliver a truly exciting and innovative product.   
  
Help our customers on the KIT implementation journey by:

- Preparing, running and following up on configuration workshops
- Managing customers’ expectations of what KIT can do and the best way to utilise KIT to achieve a business outcome
- Identify integration requirements and potential constraints
- Supporting the product owner in identifying and articulating new requirements or stories
- Provide support to the testing team in the creation of COAs and representing the customer during any discussion on testing
- Support the sales team in the preparation of bids, running sales demos and attending bid presentations

Required Skills

- 2 Years+ Business Analyst Experience working on the implementation of products
- Demonstrate an ability to understand the customer and their requirements
- Demonstrate an ability to influence the customer and mange to a set of product strengths
- Ability to understand interactions between complex IT systems and clearly communicate the interaction between systems
- Experience working in an Agile environment

**The role is a permanent role based in our Toronto, Canada Office **** with occasional travel.**

**We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.**

**Company Information**

Keytree helps companies become leaner, faster and more agile with our award-winning team of SAP experts and beautifully designed applications. The way we work sets us apart. Our multi-disciplined teams are built on a foundation of communications and accountability. We are driven by innovation and a passion for design and great user experience.

At Keytree we work with our clients to understand their business goals and solve their problems using our technological and industry expertise.

  • Managing customers’ expectations of what KIT can do and the best way to utilise KIT to achieve a business outcome
  • Identify integration requirements and potential constraints

Required Skills

  • Demonstrate an ability to understand the customer and their requirements
  • Demonstrate an ability to influence the customer and mange to a set of product strengths
  • Ability to understand interactions between complex IT systems and clearly communicate the interaction between systems
  • Experience working in an Agile environment

The role is a permanent role based in our Toronto, Canada Office ** with occasional travel.**

We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.
